inspiracio.xml
Class XMLString

java.lang.Object

public class XMLString
extends Object

Helpers for manipulating Strings with XML content.

stripSmartQuotes

public static String stripSmartQuotes(String in)
Parses the string passed as parameter to substitute special characters that are not defined in the standard ISO-8859-1 to be enabled to be used in an xml document

Parameters:
in - String to be parsed
Returns:
The same string passed as parameter

stripComments

public static String stripComments(String xml)
Removes XML-style comments from a String. Removes all occurrences of "<!-- something -->".

Parameters:
xml - String that may contain XML-comments
Returns:
the same String without XML-comments

escape

public static String escape(String s)
Escapes a String for inserting in XML elements. Assume thats the encoding of the XML is UTF-8 and does not escape accents and so on. An exact re-implementation of ColdFusion's HTMLEdit function, but independent of coldfusion-classes. In detail, does:
intcharescape(c)escape(c).length()
13CR[empty String]0
34"&quot;6
38&&amp;5
60<&lt;4
62>&gt;4

Parameters:
s - The string to escape.
Returns:
The string with the replacements done.

unescape

public static String unescape(String s)
Unescapes a String that comes from XML to get back the original string. The inverse function of escape(String): String.

In detail, does:

sunescape(c)
&quot;"
&amp;&
&lt;<
&gt;>
Maybe there is some XML-API function that improves and generalises this, and replaces all entities.

Parameters:
s - The string to unescape.
Returns:
The string with the replacements done.

main

testing

Parameters:
args -
